alert.note: Alert for Houston (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 2:23PM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...North of Interstate 90 Corridor in Wisconsin Upgraded to a Winter Storm Warning... .A strong winter storm will affect the region from late tonight into Saturday morning with heavy snow, wind, and bitterly cold temperatures. Blowing and drifting snow are expected. There could also be pockets of whiteout conditions, as wind gusts increase Friday to 40 mph, especially in open areas of northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota. Hourly snowfall amounts will range from 0.5 to 1.5 inches per hour on Friday morning. There will be a brief lull during the early morning and then ratios will then increase again during the late afternoon and Friday night. Snow amounts will range from 5 to 13 inches. The highest snow totals 8 to 13 inches are from southwest into central Wisconsin. This is the same area that was hit earlier in the week with the most snow. Snow totals will continue to monitored and refined as the storm approaches. Widespread travel impacts are expected Friday into Saturday. Consider altering, delaying or even canceling travel plans if conditions warrant it. Bitterly cold air arrives as this storm system exits the area. This will lead to wind chills of 20 to 30 below by Saturday night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 13 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Iowa, southeast Minnesota and central, southwest and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
